thread.title: First Lady Melania Trump reveals her love of gardening as she hosts wife of Japanese PM
thread.title_full: First Lady Melania Trump reveals her love of gardening as she hosts wife of Japanese PM

author: David Millward
title: First Lady Melania Trump reveals her love of gardening as she hosts wife of Japanese PM
text:
First Lady Melania Trump reveals her love of gardening as she hosts wife of Japanese PM U.S. First Lady Melania Trump (R) and Akie Abe Credit: Joe Skipper/Reuters David Millward , US Correspondent  40am 
M ichelle Obama was well-known as a keen gardener and it is a tradition which her successor, Melania Trump, intends to maintain. 
The First Lady demonstrated her interest in horticulture while hosting Akie Abe, wife of Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe. 
"The First Lady has a deep personal commitment to her role as caretaker and nurturer, beginning with her family. She believes there is a connection between a child's mind and places of calm and beauty to be used as a tool for us all,” Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, senior adviser to the First Lady, said in a statement to CNN. First lady Michelle Obama, joined by school children participate in a harvest of the White House Kitchen Credit: Harnik/AP 
“As a mother and as the First Lady of this country, Mrs. Trump is committed to the preservation and continuation of the White House Gardens, specifically the First Lady's Kitchen Garden and the Rose Garden." 
M rs Trump revealed here interest in gardening as she accompanied Mrs Abe on a tour of of Morikami Museum and Japanese Garden in Delray Beach, Florida. 
Her predecessor’s enthusiasm for gardening was well documented. She planted the White House Kitchen Garden on the South Lawn in the spring of 2009. It was part of her drive to encourage healthy eating in the United States. 
It provided produce which went from the garden to the Obama’s kitchen table.
